185390656.review:
This game is the only game where, one moment, you can have a super authentic and intense line battle between hundreds of players, and the next, get charged by a large group of confederates blasting free bird on a sound bird and shouting racial slurs. 10/10

But seriously, this game is great and (for all you history buffs out there) pays a close attention to detail with all of its features, not only with historical uniforms, weapons, narrations and maps (some A-historical maps), but it also pushes the community to actually PLAY historically. The graphics are great, and only getting better with each update allowing us to get some truly cinematic moments. The community is also generally kind and welcoming to new players, even on the johnny reb side. Definitely worth its price, even without a sale. Truly a 10/10

Another cool thing they have is after every battle theyll give you a description of the historical significance behind each battle and even alt history scenarios. This game is a must have for anyone with the tism

184657080.review:
GRAPHICS- 9/10 close enough to the real thing for me.
SOUND- 10/10 eargasmic volley fire, as if 1000 firecrackers busted a nut in my ear then left me with tinnitus.
ATMOSPHERE- 10/10 I've literally never been more immersed in a game than when I'm playing this one it feels so locked into its own time period that I start up talking like a crazed yokel lol.
PLAYER NUMBERS ARE LOW- 6/10 best way to experience this game's PvP is to join a relatively chill Regiment through the game's discord

-This game is good if you like dying in a line with a buncha screaming men and constantly getting bad COs on public servers lol honestly this game needs to keep its Halloween PvE mode as a permanent game mode as it would allow for players to take a break from the PvP for a bit instead of taking a break from the game entirely. I know I'd be clocking a lot more hours on this game if the PvE was always available to me. also if you're one of those players that thinks the VIDEO GAME needs to be as realistic as possible for reenactment or simulation purposes and the PvE will ruin the point of the game; I whole heartily disagree with your selfish play style and think by having a larger variety of player choice will result in an increase in player numbers and play time. 8/10

184656005.review: After playing War of Rights for over a year and half, there is no other black-powder civil war game better on the market. This game has it all; realistic guns, an interactive character & uniform customization, working artillery, an engaged community, and frequent updates. If you're looking for a black-powder game on the market you should pick up War of Rights.

184596912.review:
An incredible game that's gotten even better over the years. Bug fixes and patches, new maps and the addition of new assets has made this game outstanding. The detail of customization you can give your soldier, from different hairstyles to skin to uniforms, as well as the historical and geological accuracy set the experience above everything else. Not only that, but there is true freedom of speech and opinion. You'll find the most annoying SJW Redditors screeching about they want to kill right wing people going bayonet to bayonet with a drunken boomer laughing at them and calling them names to make them seethe more. If you find a good group of players to settle in with, you'll feel right at home. Teamkilling is punished and trolls are slapped around.

This game is about realism, accuracy, discipline and teamwork. In all of those aspects, it delivers fantastically. Don't forget to sign up for artillery practice. It's a hoot and takes real skill.

Deo Vindice.

184551741.review:
This gem of a game was a real surprise for me, in the sense that I've bought it expecting to be full of teeny to mid-aged racists and wannabes, and it turned out to be quite the other way around actually. 

Of course it has a low playerbase and the server population fluctuates a lot. It also has some stupid people who joins CSA and keeps flooding and disrupting important team info in the chat with racist slurs in a pathetic attempt to make his own miserable existence evident to everyone else in the server. But even these are very uncommon due to the very good server management and the very funny and mature playerbase that acts with the due rigor when necessary, and they also try to encourage and coordinate the team to play following the historical army behavior and formations, which is quite good in this game imho.

Those nearby explosions and massive cannonball impacts that sometimes launches your character on the ground is also another feature that I've never thought I would miss in other games, and it made a big difference in how "human" it feels while playing, the character is not that stiff thing that can withstand grenades and rocket blasts without even kneeling down or being sent airborne.

11/10, would buy it on full price and would not regret it.

184508825.review:
I only have about 2 hours of playtime in War of Rights, but that was more than enough to experience the toxic community, unbearable lag, and overall disappointment that makes this game a complete waste of time. This is not the kind of game that requires hours of gameplay to understand or dive into a meaningful story. I don’t often leave reviews, but this game truly deserves to be called out. War of Rights is one of the most frustrating and disappointing experiences I’ve had in recent gaming history, and I genuinely regret spending both my time and money on it.

First off, the community is absolutely toxic. I’ve never encountered a game with such a high concentration of racist comments and offensive behavior. The player base is filled with vile individuals who don’t hesitate to make the experience unbearable with their hate speech and disgusting remarks. It’s enough to make you want to quit immediately.

But it gets worse. The so-called "experienced" players are incredibly entitled and rude. If you don’t play the game exactly how they want you to, they’ll verbally attack you, demand you follow their orders, or even kick you from the game. There’s no room for individual playstyles, and if you’re new, be prepared to get bullied by these "veterans."

The gameplay in War of Rights is painfully slow-paced and rooted in "realism"—which sounds great in theory but is tedious in practice. Reloading your weapon takes forever, mirroring the long, grueling process of the Civil War era, and running drains your stamina at an alarming rate, making it feel like you're trudging through mud. If you're not in "formation," you're penalized, which restricts your freedom and adds unnecessary pressure to an already frustrating experience. Defending yourself against stabs or close combat is nearly impossible, and the difficulty of distinguishing friend from foe in the chaotic battlefield only adds to the confusion. The objectives are poorly explained, often obscure, and frankly, boring, making it feel more like a slog than a meaningful battle.

Then there’s the technical side of things. No matter how powerful your PC or fast your internet speed is, War of Rights is an absolute lag-fest. I can barely play without constant stuttering and delay, even with top-tier specs and the best connection money can buy. It feels like the game was made for hardware from 2000, not something capable of handling modern titles.

To top it off, there is only ONE active PUG server, and it’s filled with trolls. These players think it’s hilarious to team-kill, ruin the game for everyone, and generally destroy any chance of having a fun experience. It’s the same toxic group of players over and over again, and the server is hardly ever populated with anyone else. The game is essentially dead, with no active community to support it.

In short, War of Rights is a mess—the gameplay, the community, and the technical performance are all subpar. Save yourself the frustration and skip this one entirely. There are far better games out there that don’t come with a racist community and toxic leadership demanding you worship them. I’m sure all the racist, toxic trolls will disagree.
